alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 25 at 11:17AM CST until January 27 at 5:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tchefuncte River Near Folsom affecting St. Tammany Parish. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Tchefuncte River Above U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington affecting St. Tammany Parish. For the Tchefuncte River...including Folsom, U.S. Highway 190 Near Covington...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tchefuncte River near Folsom. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Louisiana Highway 40 will overflow the west bank by the bridge. Evacuation of the area around Spring Park and Albert Thompson roads should be complete. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 18.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.5 feet this evening. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 01/08/1998. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1130 PM CST.
